ARSENAL & BARCA BATTLE FOR BRAGA STARLET

Arsenal and Barcelona are battling to make Braga teenager Pedro Neto the second most expensive 17-year-old in football history, according to A Bola.

Braga have already rejected a €15 million (£13.2m) offer from Arsenal for the forward and won’t sell for less than his €20m (£17.6m) release clause.

Barcelona are reportedly preparing to make a final offer in the coming days and that could lead to Neto being behind only Alexandre Pato in the list of most expensive 17-year-old footballers.

NIANG WAITING ON ARSENAL OFFER

AC Milan striker M’Baye Niang is hoping Arsenal will make him an offer after stalling on a move to Everton, according to Calciomercato.com.

Everton have agreed a €15 million (£13.2m) fee with Milan to sign Niang, but the player has yet to accept a switch to Goodison Park as he holds out for a transfer to a bigger club.

GIROUD WANTS WENGER TALKS

Olivier Giroud is set to hold talks with Arsene Wenger over his future at Arsenal as the club close in on the signing of Lyon striker Alexandre Lacazette, according to the Evening Standard.

Giroud, who has also been linked with West Ham, has been tipped to be used as a makeweight in Arsenal’s bid for Lacazette and wants clarification from Wenger over his situation at the Emirates Stadium.

#AFC expect Ox to sign a new deal but he will ask for assurances on his role before committing his future.

Arsenal expect Oxlade-Chamberlain to sign a new deal worth in the region of £100,000-a-week but negotiations have slowed with the midfielder determined to ensure he is a key part of manager Arsene Wenger’s plans.

Wenger is keen to keep Oxlade-Chamberlain, however, in addition to Theo Walcott, who was this morning linked with a move to West Ham.

Walcott found regular opportunities hard to come by once Wenger changed systems last season but it is understood he has no desire to leave the club at the present time.
